article_title: A Bet on Health Care May Help Offset Tuition Increases
article_text:
The bad news: College tuition keeps going up.

The good news: So do health-care costs.

The idea: If investors buy mutual funds or exchange-traded funds that focus on health care, they might be able to take advantage of rising health-care prices to...

twitter.description: One way for parents to plan for college costs is to invest in stocks that have the potential for significant growth. With health-care costs on the rise, that sector is one candidate.
twitter.title: College Try: To Offset Tuition, a Bet on Health Care

image.alt: College tuition pain? A surprising solution could be to invest in health-care stocks.
